API Reference¶

NoteUtil¶

class noteutil.noteutil.NoteUtil(config_file: str)[source]¶

NoteUtil is used for retrieving and manipulating Notes. It must be configured with a config file.

Parameters:config_file (str) – The name of the config file that is used to set up this NoteUtil.
note_file¶

The name of the file with notes, likely a text file.

Type:str
nu_file¶

The same name of the file with notes, but with a .nu extension indicating NoteUtil modified.

Type:str
comments¶

The prefix of lines that should be ignored in the note file.

Type:str
separator¶

A delimiter used to split Note lines into pairs (terms and definitions).

Type:str
notes¶

All `Note`s created from the .nu file.

Type:List[Note]
heading_char¶

If a Note is a heading, its content will start with this character.

Type:str
levels¶

The number of headings.

Type:int
level_names¶

The general name of each group of headings.

Type:List[str]
heading_names¶

The list of all heading names in chronological order.

Type:List[str]
heading_level¶

Mapped general names of headings to a list of notes that are headings that belong to that name.

Type:Dict[str, List[Note]]
heading_order¶

Chronological list of notes that are headings.

Type:List[Note]
extension_names¶

List of all generic names of the extensions.

Type:List[str]
extension_bounds¶

List of all (left bound, right bound) tuples that correspond to the extension names. zip(extension_names, extension_bounds) gives correctly corresponding names and bounds.

Type:List[Tuple[str, str]]
extensions¶

All `Note`s that have extensions.

Type:List[Note]
pairs¶

All `Note`s that have terms and definitions.

Type:List[Note]
warnings¶

List of all of the warnings that occurred during the Note creation process.

Type:List[str]
errors¶

List of all of the errors that occurred during the Note creation process.

Type:List[str]
Raises:NoteError – If there were any severe problems during the Note creation process.
edit(note: noteutil.notes.Note, content: str, override: bool = False) → None[source]¶

Given a Note, edit its content. This can have many side effects:

  1. Changes to heading_name.
  2. Changes to extensions.
  3. Changes to whether the Note is a pair.
  4. Changes to term, definition, and separator
Parameters:
  • note (Note) – A Note that you want to modify.
  • content (str) – The new content that the Note should have.
  • override (bool) – Whether to override the warning when editing the content.
Returns:
Return type:

None
Raises:
  • MissingBound
  • ExtraSeparator
  • DuplicateTerm
  • NoDefinition
get(**kwargs) → Union[None, noteutil.notes.Note][source]¶

Retrieves a Note with attributes equal to passed keyword args.

Parameters:kwargs – Keys are attribute names and Values are values you are looking for in those attributes.
Other Parameters:
 compare – If one of the keys of kwargs is compare, comparisons will be used with the value of this key. The custom compare must accept the parameters: Note, **kwargs
Returns:If a Note is found to have the passed attributes. If no Note is found.
Return type:Note or None
get_list(**kwargs) → Union[None, List[noteutil.notes.Note]][source]¶

Retrieves all `Note`s with attributes equal to passed keyword args and stores them in a List.

Parameters:kwargs – Keys are attribute names and Values are values you are looking for in those attributes.
Other Parameters:
 compare – If one of the keys of kwargs is compare, comparisons will be used with the value of this key. The custom compare must accept the parameters: Note, **kwargs
Returns:If a `Note`s are found to have the passed attributes. If no `Note`s are found.
Return type:List[Note] or None
reformat() → None[source]¶

Writes all of the `Note`s back into what they were when they were being parsed into a .nu file.

If any changes to the `Note`s were made, they will be written here as well.

Returns:
Return type:None

Quiz¶

class noteutil.quiz.Quiz(noteutil: noteutil.noteutil.NoteUtil)[source]¶

Quiz takes terms and definitions of `Note`s and generates them in useful sequences. It keeps track of which terms were marked correct and which terms were marked incorrect.

Parameters:noteutil (NoteUtil) – The NoteUtil that has the terms and definitions to be used with this Quiz.
noteutil¶
Type:NoteUtil
last_nindex¶

The nindex of the last Note generated.

Type:int
correct¶

All `Note`s marked as correct.

Type:List[Note]
incorrect¶

All `Note`s marked as incorrect.

Type:List[Note]
pairs¶

List of all Note`s that are pairs that the `Quiz is generating from. This can either be all pairs in NoteUtil, or only pairs inside a specific heading.

Type:List[Note]
heading¶

The heading whose pairs are being used. It is None if pairs are being used from all of NoteUtil’s pairs, or the correct/incorrect list.

Type:None or Note
qz_file¶

File name for the .qz file to save the Quiz’s correct and incorrect lists.

Type:str
append(pair: noteutil.notes.Note, *, correct: bool) → None[source]¶

Adds a pair to one of the correct or incorrect lists. It will also remove it from the other list if it’s in that one.

Parameters:
  • pair (Note) – The pair to add to either the correct list or the incorrect list.
  • correct (bool) – Whether to add to the correct list (T) or the incorrect list (F).
Returns:
Return type:

None
clear() → None[source]¶

Empties the correct and incorrect lists.

Returns:
Return type:None
generate(*, randomize: bool, unmarked: bool = False) → Generator[[noteutil.notes.Note, None], None][source]¶

A generator that yields Note`s, either chronologically or randomly. Once a generator is created, it is “frozen in time,” and isn’t affected by any changes to `Quiz. However, Quiz keeps track of the last index used, which changes every time this generator is activated.

Parameters:
  • randomize (bool) – Whether to generate a random term from the list of pairs.
  • unmarked (bool) – Whether to only generate terms that have not been marked as correct/incorrect.
Yields:

Note – A pair that is either in random or chronological order.
load() → None[source]¶

Loads correct and incorrect terms to a .qz file.

Returns:
Return type:None
refresh(noteutil: noteutil.noteutil.NoteUtil) → None[source]¶

Resets the state of the Quiz to match a new NoteUtil. This is the same as saving the NoteUtil and then loading it with a different NoteUtil. As such, only identical `Note`s from both `NoteUtil`s are kept.

Returns:
Return type:None
remove(pair: noteutil.notes.Note, *, correct: bool) → None[source]¶

Removes a pair from one of the correct or incorrect lists.

Parameters:
  • pair (Note) – The pair to remove from either the correct list or the incorrect list.
  • correct (bool) – Whether to remove from the correct list (T) or the incorrect list (F).
Returns:
Return type:

None
reset() → None[source]¶

Resets the state of the Quiz to as if it had just been initialized.

Returns:
Return type:None
save() → None[source]¶

Writes correct and incorrect terms to a .qz file.

Returns:
Return type:None
select_heading(heading: Union[None, str, noteutil.notes.Note]) → None[source]¶

Changes the current heading and pairs to match the pairs in the given heading.

Parameters:

heading (None or Note or str) – The Note or heading name whose pairs should be used. If the heading name is “correct” or “incorrect”, the pairs in the corresponding list will be used. If left as None, all pairs in NoteUtil will be used.
Returns:
Return type:

None
Raises:
  • HeadingExpected – If the Note provided is not None and isn’t a heading.
  • HeadingNotFound – If the str provided is not None and it isn’t a recognized heading name.
class noteutil.quiz.Leitner(noteutil: noteutil.noteutil.NoteUtil)[source]¶

The Leitner system is a method of spaced repetition where cards are reviewed at increasing intervals.

If we model a pair as a flashcard (term and definition), then we can also use the Leitner system. We use seven “boxes” numbered 1-7, and every time our session is divisible by the box number, we review that box. Any terms that we mark as correct will advance to the next box number (+1), and incorrect ones will reset to box 1.

Parameters:noteutil (NoteUtil) – The NoteUtil that has terms an definitions to be used in this Leitner.
noteutil¶
Type:NoteUtil
last_nindex¶

The note index of the last Note generated.

Type:int
boxes¶

A dictionary where each box number (key) maps to the list of `Note`s inside of it (value).

Type:Dict[int, List[Note]]
times¶

A dictionary where each box number (key) maps to the time period before review (# of sessions) (value).

Type:Dict[int, int]
session¶

The session number that determines which boxes will be reviewed.

Type:int
lt_file¶

The name of the .lt file that will save Leitner’s boxes.

Type:str
add_box(time: int) → None[source]¶

Adds an additional box to store pairs in.

Parameters:time (int) – The time period for the box to be added. Must be greater than the time period of the last box before this one.
Returns:
Return type:None
correct(pair: noteutil.notes.Note) → None[source]¶

Handles the pair if it was answered correctly. Removes it from its current box and then moves it to the next box.

Parameters:pair (Note) – The pair that was answered correctly.
Returns:
Return type:None
generate() → Generator[[noteutil.notes.Note, None], None][source]¶

A generator that yields `Note`s according to the session number. If the session number is divisible by the time on a box, then we review that box.

Yields:Note – A randomly selected pair from all of the pairs we are reviewing in this session.
incorrect(pair: noteutil.notes.Note) → None[source]¶

Handles the pair if it was answered correctly. Removes it from its current box and then moves it to the next box.

Parameters:pair (Note) – The pair that was answered incorrectly.
Returns:
Return type:None
load() → None[source]¶

Loads a Leitner state from a .lt file.

Returns:
Return type:None
pop_box()[source]¶

Pops the last box and moves the lost pairs to the box before the one just popped.

Returns:
Return type:None
refresh(noteutil: noteutil.noteutil.NoteUtil) → None[source]¶

Resets the state of the Leitner to match a new NoteUtil. This is the same as saving the NoteUtil and then loading it with a different NoteUtil. As such, only identical `Note`s from both `NoteUtil`s are kept.

Returns:
Return type:None
reset() → None[source]¶

Resets the state of the Leitner to as if it had just been initialized.

Returns:
Return type:None
save() → None[source]¶

Writes Leitner state to a .lt file.

Returns:
Return type:None

Notes¶

class noteutil.notes.Note(content, nindex, **kwargs)[source]¶

A Note is the text found in the notes file. It contains the actual notes from each line of text. They can be Headings, which means a group of notes that come after this Note belong to this Note.

Only notes that come directly after this heading and before the next heading will belong to this Note. It is impossible to go back to this heading after we have passed the next heading.

They can have Extensions, which are additional information added on separately from the content of this Note. They can be Pairs, which means it has a separator, term, and definition that can be used for quizzing.

Parameters:
  • content (str) – The content of the Note excluding prefixes and Extensions.
  • nindex (int) – The Note index that corresponds to the position in the NoteUtil.notes.
  • **kwargs – Any other parameters that extend the Note.
Other Parameters:
 

  • If the `Note` is a `Heading` –

    heading_char : str

    The character used as to indicate this Note is a heading.

    level : int

    The depth of heading hierarchy of this Note.

    heading : str

    The prefix of the content that was removed and the actual heading string.

    heading_name : str

    The content of the Note without the heading.

    begin_nindex : int

    The beginning note index for this heading.

    end_nindex : int

    The ending note index for this heading.

    nindexes : List[int]

    List of indexes starting from the begin_nindex to the end_nindex like a range.

  • If the `Note` is a `Pair` –

    term : str

    The first part of text that came before the separator.

    definition : str

    The second part of text that came after the separator.

    separator : str

    The string that separates the term and definition of this Note.
has_extensions() → bool[source]¶

Returns whether the Note has any extensions.

Returns:
Return type:bool
is_heading() → bool[source]¶

Returns whether the Note should have the parameters of a heading.

Returns:
Return type:bool
is_pair() → bool[source]¶

Returns whether the Note should have the parameters of a pair.

Returns:
Return type:bool
rcontent¶

What a Note looked like before parsing it.

class noteutil.notes.Extension(content: str, name: str, lbound: str, rbound: str)[source]¶

An Extension is additional text added on to a Note. All Extensions have a corresponding name and bounded characters to distinguish it from the content of a Note. The Extension is taken out of the content of a Note and lives in a Note’s extensions List.

Parameters:
  • content (str) – The actual notes of the Extension without any bounds.
  • name (str) – The general name associated with the Extension/What it falls under.
  • lbound (str) – The string that bounds the left side of the Extension.
  • rbound (str) – The string that bounds the right side of the Extension.
content¶
Type:str
name¶
Type:str
lbound¶
Type:str
rbound¶
Type:str

Comparisons¶

This module is for comparisons used when comparing Note`s in `NoteUtil.

class noteutil.comparisons.CompareOptions[source]¶

Enum for selecting compare options for NoteUtil.get methods. The Enums here are only a few of the possible comparing options for `Note`s. You are encouraged to develop your own to suit your needs.

EQUALS : function
Tests for equality. Use with ints, or when you want exact matching.
SIMILAR : function
Tests for equals ignore case. Use with strings when you want to match, but ignore case.
IN : function
Tests for “in”. Use with strings when you want to know if the exact value is in the attribute.
SIN : function
Tests for “in” and also ignores case. Use with strings when you want to know if the value is in the attribute. Stands for “Similar In”.
EQUALS(**kwargs) → bool¶

Is True when all of the kwargs values are exactly equal to the Note’s attributes.

Returns:
Return type:bool
IN(**kwargs) → bool¶

Is True when all of the kwargs values are “in” the Note’s attributes.

Returns:
Return type:bool
SIMILAR(**kwargs) → bool¶

Is True when all of the kwargs values are equal ignoring case to the Note’s attributes.

Returns:
Return type:bool
SIN(**kwargs) → bool¶

Is True when all of the kwargs values are “in” ignoring case to the Note’s attributes.

Returns:
Return type:bool
noteutil.comparisons.is_equal(note, **kwargs) → bool[source]¶

Is True when all of the kwargs values are exactly equal to the Note’s attributes.

Returns:
Return type:bool
noteutil.comparisons.is_in(note, **kwargs) → bool[source]¶

Is True when all of the kwargs values are “in” the Note’s attributes.

Returns:
Return type:bool
noteutil.comparisons.is_similar(note, **kwargs) → bool[source]¶

Is True when all of the kwargs values are equal ignoring case to the Note’s attributes.

Returns:
Return type:bool
noteutil.comparisons.is_similar_in(note, **kwargs) → bool[source]¶

Is True when all of the kwargs values are “in” ignoring case to the Note’s attributes.

Returns:
Return type:bool
